channel.title: Whonix 12 testers repository - Notes
channel.description:
It's ready...
mirror.whonix.org always lags behind. Either wait ~1 hour. Or use this...
In summary...
[code] sudo whonix_repository --baseuri http://sourceforge.net/projects/whonixdevelopermetafiles/files/internal/ --repository testers --enable && \ sudo apt-get update && \ sudo apt-get --yes dist-upgrade && \ sudo apt-get --yes autoremove [/code]
Some notes...
[hr]
Tor Browser will no be started from the old location...
[code]/home/user/tor-browser_en-US[/code]
or this old location...
[code]/home/user/.tb/tor-browser_en-US[/code]
but from the new location...
[code]/home/user/.tb/tor-browser[/code]
(Reason: https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,860.msg11316.html#msg11316)
There is no convenient upgrade path yet during this transition.
In short... Either run these two commands (one will fail, one should work)...
[code]mv /home/user/.tb/tor-browser_en-US /home/user/.tb/tor-browser[/code] [code]mv /home/user/tor-browser_en-US /home/user/.tb/tor-browser[/code]
Or you will be asked to download a new Tor Browser. I'll guess I'll automate that.
There are no new images yet. Soon there will be a release candidate.

item.title: Whonix 12 testers repository - Notes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Two upgraded packages coming. anon-gw-anonymizer-config and whonixcheck. Fixes for the following.

github.com/Whonix/anon-gw-anonymizer-config

Use KeepAliveIsolateSOCKSAuth against TB fingerprinting

by rustybird on 05:17PM - 23 Nov 15
1 commits changed 2 files with 3 additions and 3 deletions.
Recurring Time Error within Gateway 11 under VirtualBox 5 - ERROR: Unwanted PVClock kvm-clock tsc acpi_pm detected! VirtualBox
The git commit. @HulaHoop please consider testing if kvm-clock detection would still work in KVM. Still have to produce an upgraded package.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 12 testers repository - Notes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It’s ready…

mirror.whonix.org always lags behind. Either wait ~1 hour. Or use this…

In summary…

sudo whonix_repository --baseuri http://sourceforge.net/projects/whonixdevelopermetafiles/files/internal/ --repository testers --enable && \
sudo apt-get update && \
sudo apt-get --yes dist-upgrade && \
sudo apt-get --yes autoremove

Some notes…

[hr]

Tor Browser will no be started from the old location…

or this old location…

but from the new location…

(Reason: https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,860.msg11316.html#msg11316)

There is no convenient upgrade path yet during this transition.

In short… Either run these two commands (one will fail, one should work)…

Or you will be asked to download a new Tor Browser. I’ll guess I’ll automate that.

There are no new images yet. Soon there will be a release candidate.

Read full topic
